name: Llangennith
description: Gower's surf epicentre. 3-mile beach works on all tides with multiple peaks. North end rockier and more powerful; middle section best for learners. Gets busy but enough peaks for everyone.

name: Rhossili Bay
access_notes: Walk down from village car park 10 mins
description: Spectacular setting beneath Rhossili Down. Same swell as Llangennith but often less crowded. The walk in puts off casual visitors. Strong rips when big.

name: Langland Bay
description: Sheltered bay that works in smaller swells. Popular with longboarders and SUPs. Gets crowded but friendly vibe. Reef at west end gives better shape.

name: Caswell Bay
description: Small sheltered bay ideal for beginners. Works best on smaller swells. Almost disappears at high tide. Rock pools good for kids when flat.

name: Port Eynon
description: Quieter alternative to Llangennith. Works on similar swells but more sheltered. Good for improvers wanting less crowd.

name: Freshwater West
description: Pembrokeshire's most powerful beach. Featured in Harry Potter. Picks up more swell than anywhere in Wales. Strong currents - not for beginners. Spectacular when big.

name: Whitesands Bay
description: Pembrokeshire's most popular surf beach. Consistent waves, RNLI lifeguards, surf school. Near St Davids so gets busy. Beautiful setting.

name: Newgale
description: 2-mile beach with reliable surf. Less powerful than Freshwater West but more accessible. Storm pebble bank at top of beach.

name: Manorbier
description: Beautiful bay beneath castle. Reef at south end gives better shape. Works on south swells when west coast is flat. Uncrowded gem.

name: Broad Haven South
access_notes: Walk from Bosherston car park 15 mins
description: Stunning National Trust beach. Walk in keeps crowds away. Sheltered so works when exposed beaches are maxed out. Lily ponds nearby.

name: Porth Neigwl (Hell's Mouth)
description: 4-mile beach facing full Atlantic. Can get massive. Strong rips and currents. Remote location - no facilities. For experienced surfers only.

name: Abersoch
description: Sheltered town beach. Small waves suit beginners and SUPs. Popular holiday destination so busy in summer. Works on south swells.

name: Rhosneigr
description: Anglesey's surf hub. Consistent beach break with mellow vibe. Kitesurfers share the beach. Good facilities and village atmosphere.

name: Porth Oer (Whistling Sands)
access_notes: National Trust car park walk 5 mins
description: Famous squeaky sand. North-facing so works on different swells. Sheltered and scenic. Good for beginners on small days.

name: Rest Bay
description: South Wales' most consistent surf beach. Close to M4 so accessible. Reliable waves and good facilities. Surf school base.
